sailpoint.connector

Class CollectorServices

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.connector.CollectorServices
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractConnector

    public class CollectorServices
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that offers services that are common for all Connectors and Collectors in IdentityIQ. It has utility methods for coercing values, running rules and getting values out of the Configuration Attributes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      • getSchemaConfig

        public java.lang.Object getSchemaConfig(Schema schema,
                               java.lang.String name)
                                 throws sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Get an attribute from the configuration that has been scoped to a schema. The idea here is to allow customers to prefix the schema name with an attribute to cause different behaviors while processing the different schema types. A common example is the the file configuration setting on the delimiter file connector where there are two files one for groups and one for accounts.

        This method supports two different types of naming styles.

        1) (recommended) schemaObjectType.attributeName (for example, account.delimiter) 2) schemaObjectTypeattributeName (for example, accountdelimiter)

        #2 is supported only for backward compatibility. The dotted notation in #1 is the preferred way to describe attributes for a particular schema type.

        If a null value is returned from the schema prefixed config and the schema type is 'account' this method will return the value using the name of the attribute without the prefix.

        Throws:
        sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException

      • getSchemaConfigList

        public java.util.List getSchemaConfigList(Schema schema,
                                 java.lang.String name)
                                   throws sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Return an attribute value as a List from the requested Schema.
        Throws:
        sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        See Also:
        CollectorServices.getSchemaConfig(Schema, String)

      • getSchemaConfig

        public java.lang.Object getSchemaConfig(Schema schema,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               boolean defaultToUnprefixed)
                                 throws sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        Get an attribute from the configuration that has been scoped to a schema. If defaultToUnprefixed is true, this will search for an attribute in the schema that does not have the schema name as a dotted prefix.
        Throws:
        sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
        See Also:
        CollectorServices.getSchemaConfig(Schema, String)

      • getAttributes

        public Attributes<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getAttributes()
        Returns the configuration Attributes (Map) from the Application. This method returns a copy of the attributes defined on the application so callers do not accidentally modify properties that will get persisted.

      • buildList

      • buildStringList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildStringList(java.lang.String string)
        Build a list of strings from a single string. If the string value contains a , it will attempt to coerce it to a list from csv. Otherwise a single entry list will be created.

      • buildStringList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> buildStringList(java.lang.String string,
                                               boolean csv)
        Build a list of strings from a single string. If the string value contains a , it will attempt to coerce it to a list from csv. Otherwise a single entry list will be created.
